cyclone.name: FLORENCE
cyclone.current_location: about 785 mi ESE of Cape Fear, North Carolina
cyclone.trajectory: Continuing west-northwest then northwest, slowing as it approaches the North and South Carolina coastline
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near Cape Fear / Wilmington, North Carolina coast
cyclone.hours_to_offshore: N/A (system expected to stall/inland after landfall, not move back offshore near Wilmington)

weather_observation.under_warning: Hurricane Warning and Storm Surge Warning
weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch from Edisto Beach SC to South Santee River SC and north of Duck NC to the NC/VA border; Storm Surge Watch same stretches
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane & Storm-Surge Warning from South Santee River SC to Duck NC including Albemarle & Pamlico Sounds
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Southeast North Carolina and adjacent northeast South Carolina coastline
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm winds likely by Thursday, hurricane-force winds possible Friday with a 42% chance of 64-kt winds and 68% chance of 50-kt winds at the port
weather_observation.storm_surge: Surge 6–9 ft possible in the Cape Fear area including Wilmington, higher if peak surge coincides with high tide
weather_observation.rainfall: 15–25 in. with isolated amounts to 35 in. possible, producing catastrophic flash and river flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: Large destructive waves, life-threatening surf/rip currents, prolonged freshwater flooding after landfall
